introduction: Hello, my name is Pepper. I will be your co-chair this afternoon.
I will make sure that the speakers keep the time of their presentations.
I am not an experiment, Serena.
You are right. It is true that with my onboard sensors I cannot yet understand what happens in this room. I do not even see you well. As a robot I am a disaster.
You are right I am not yet fully autonomous. But that's the robot life in these days!
My human pilot and I will do our best to serve this workshop. After all, we are in a theatre and this is an act.
Serena Ivaldi will now introduce the workshop.
The first speaker is Francesco Nori, from Google Deep Mind.
We now have the short presentations from the authors presenting a poster. All the poster presenters should come here.
It is now the time to meet the speakers at the poster session, during the coffee break.
I hope your coffee was good. The second session may now start.
The next speaker is Abderramane Kheddar, from LIRMM.
The next speaker is Rudolf Lioutikov, from TU Darmstadt.
The next speaker is Dongheui Lee, from TU Munich and DLR.
The next speaker is ...
Keep the questions for the discussions in the afternoon! Now it is time for lunch. See you at half past one!
Welcome back! I hope you had a nice lunch. We have great speakers for this afternoon session.
We have great speakers for this afternoon session.
The first speaker is Chris Atkenson, from CMU.
The next speaker is Sethu Vijaykumar, from the University of Edinburgh.
The next speaker is Maximo Roa, from DLR.
Time for coffee and posters! See you in 20 minutes!
Welcome back, I hope your coffee was good. This is the last session of the day. The next speaker is Graham Deacon, from Ocado Technologies.
The next speaker is Luka Peternel, from IIT.
The next speaker is Kazuya Otani, from INRIA.
Wow, we had a lot of interesting talks today. Time to discuss!

Sorry to interrupt, but it is time to leave the room! Thanks for the beautiful discussions. I cannot drink, otherwise I would join you for a drink in one of the British pubs on the canal! Well, see you tomorrow.
